trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Work.com | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Work.com | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Work.com with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Work.com with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Work.com.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Work.com.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: A Work.com single sign-on enabled subscription
trans-unit.target: A Work.com single sign-on enabled subscription

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the AAD users to whom you have assign Work.com access will be able to single sign into the application at your Work.com company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the AAD users to whom you have assign Work.com access will be able to single sign into the application at your Work.com company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for Work.com
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for Work.com

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Work.com.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Work.com.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type Work.com.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type Work.com.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select Work.com, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select Work.com, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Work.com</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Work.com</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Work.com with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Work.com with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: As part of this procedure, you are required to upload a certificate to Work.com.com.
trans-unit.target: As part of this procedure, you are required to upload a certificate to Work.com.com.

trans-unit.source: To configure single sign-on, you need to setup a custom Work.com domain name yet.
trans-unit.target: To configure single sign-on, you need to setup a custom Work.com domain name yet.

trans-unit.source: You need to define at least a domain name, test your domain name, and deploy it to your entire organization.
trans-unit.target: You need to define at least a domain name, test your domain name, and deploy it to your entire organization.

trans-unit.source: Log in to your Work.com tenant as administrator.
trans-unit.target: Log in to your Work.com tenant as administrator.

trans-unit.source: Go to Setup.
trans-unit.target: Go to Setup.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Setup</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Setup</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the left navigation pane, in the Administer section, click Domain Management to expand the related section, and then click My Domain to open the My Domain page.
trans-unit.target: On the left navigation pane, in the Administer section, click Domain Management to expand the related section, and then click My Domain to open the My Domain page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>My Domain</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>My Domain</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To verify that your domain has been setup correctly, make sure that it is in “Step 4 Deployed to Users” and review your “My Domain Settings”.
trans-unit.target: To verify that your domain has been setup correctly, make sure that it is in “Step 4 Deployed to Users” and review your “My Domain Settings”.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Doman Deployed to User</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Doman Deployed to User</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In a different web browser window, log in to your Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: In a different web browser window, log in to your Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: On the Work.com **application integration page, click **Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Work.com **application integration page, click **Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to Work.com page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to Work.com page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure App URL page, in the Work.com Sign On URL textbox, type the URL used by your users to sign on to your Work.com application (e.g.:” http://company.my.salesforce.com”), and then click Next:
trans-unit.target: On the Configure App URL page, in the Work.com Sign On URL textbox, type the URL used by your users to sign on to your Work.com application (e.g.:” http://company.my.salesforce.com”), and then click Next:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at Work.com page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file locally on your computer.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at Work.com page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file locally on your computer.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Log in to your Work.com tenant.
trans-unit.target: Log in to your Work.com tenant.

trans-unit.source: Go to Setup.
trans-unit.target: Go to Setup.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Setup</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Setup</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Expand the Security Controls menu, and then click Single Sign-On Settings.
trans-unit.target: Expand the Security Controls menu, and then click Single Sign-On Settings.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Single Sign-On Settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Single Sign-On Settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Single Sign-On Settings dialog page, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the Single Sign-On Settings dialog page, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>SAML Enabled</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>SAML Enabled</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select SAML Enabled.
trans-unit.target: Select SAML Enabled.

trans-unit.source: Click New.
trans-unit.target: Click New.

trans-unit.source: In the SAML Single Sign-On Settings section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the SAML Single Sign-On Settings section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>SAML Single Sign-On Setting</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>SAML Single Sign-On Setting</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Name textbox, type a name for your configuration.
trans-unit.target: In the Name textbox, type a name for your configuration.

trans-unit.source: Providing a value for Name does automatically populate the API Name textbox.
trans-unit.target: Providing a value for Name does automatically populate the API Name textbox.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Work.com dialog page, copy the Issuer URL value, and then paste it into the Issuer textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Work.com dialog page, copy the Issuer URL value, and then paste it into the Issuer textbox.

trans-unit.source: To upload the downloaded certificate, click Browse.
trans-unit.target: To upload the downloaded certificate, click Browse.

trans-unit.source: In the Entity Id textbox, type https://salesforce-work.com.
trans-unit.target: In the Entity Id textbox, type https://salesforce-work.com.

trans-unit.source: As SAML Identity Type, select Assertion contains the Federation ID from the User object.
trans-unit.target: As SAML Identity Type, select Assertion contains the Federation ID from the User object.

trans-unit.source: As SAML Identity Location, select Identity is in the NameIdentfier element of the Subject statement.
trans-unit.target: As SAML Identity Location, select Identity is in the NameIdentfier element of the Subject statement.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Work.com dialog page, copy the Remote Login URL value, and then paste it into the Identity Provider Login URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Work.com dialog page, copy the Remote Login URL value, and then paste it into the Identity Provider Login URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Work.com dialog page, copy the Remote Logout URL value, and then paste it into the Identity Provider Logout URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Work.com dialog page, copy the Remote Logout URL value, and then paste it into the Identity Provider Logout URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: As Service Provider Initiated Request Binding, select HTTP Post.
trans-unit.target: As Service Provider Initiated Request Binding, select HTTP Post.

trans-unit.source: Click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click Save.

trans-unit.source: In your Work.com portal, on the left navigation pane, click Domain Management to expand the related section, and then click My Domain to open the My Domain page.
trans-unit.target: In your Work.com portal, on the left navigation pane, click Domain Management to expand the related section, and then click My Domain to open the My Domain page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>My Domain</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>My Domain</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the My Domain page, in the Login Page Branding section, click Edit.
trans-unit.target: On the My Domain page, in the Login Page Branding section, click Edit.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Login Page Branding</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Login Page Branding</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Login Page Branding page, in the Authentication Service section, the name of your SAML SSO Settings is displayed.
trans-unit.target: On the Login Page Branding page, in the Authentication Service section, the name of your SAML SSO Settings is displayed.

trans-unit.source: Select it, and then click Save.
trans-unit.target: Select it, and then click Save.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Login Page Branding</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Login Page Branding</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: For Azure Active Directory users to be able to sign in, they must be provisioned to Work.com.
trans-unit.target: For Azure Active Directory users to be able to sign in, they must be provisioned to Work.com.

trans-unit.source: In the case of Work.com, provisioning is a manual task.
trans-unit.target: In the case of Work.com, provisioning is a manual task.

trans-unit.source: Sign on to your Work.com company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: Sign on to your Work.com company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: Go to Setup.
trans-unit.target: Go to Setup.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Setup</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Setup</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Go to Manage Users \> Users.
trans-unit.target: Go to Manage Users \> Users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Manage Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Manage Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click New User.
trans-unit.target: Click New User.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>All Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>All Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the User Edit section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the User Edit section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>User Edit</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>User Edit</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Type the Last Name, Alias, Email, Username and Nickname attributes of a valid Azure Active Directory account you want to provision into the related textboxes.
trans-unit.target: Type the Last Name, Alias, Email, Username and Nickname attributes of a valid Azure Active Directory account you want to provision into the related textboxes.

trans-unit.source: Select Role, User License and Profile.
trans-unit.target: Select Role, User License and Profile.

trans-unit.source: Click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click Save.

trans-unit.source: The Azure Active Directory account holder will get an email including a link to confirm the account before it becomes active.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Active Directory account holder will get an email including a link to confirm the account before it becomes active.

trans-unit.source: You can use any other Work.com user account creation tools or APIs provided by Work.com to provision AAD user accounts.
trans-unit.target: You can use any other Work.com user account creation tools or APIs provided by Work.com to provision AAD user accounts.

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the Work.com application integration page, click Assign users.
trans-unit.target: On the Work.com application integration page, click Assign users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Yes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Yes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: You should now wait for 10 minutes and verify that the account has been synchronized to Work.com.com.
trans-unit.target: You should now wait for 10 minutes and verify that the account has been synchronized to Work.com.com.

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
